history.content: I'm fairly certain that it would be no, considering I see no lower division courses explicitly listed on that page, I would think that when they generalized, they implicitly meant upper division undergrad courses.

The updated list of approved technical electives (http://guide.berkeley.edu/undergraduate/degree-programs/computer-science/#majorrequirementstext) includes "All technical undergraduate and graduate courses in PHYSICS."

I think the old list said that only upper division and grad level courses were approved, so has this been changed? Are Physics (H)7A/B/C now approved?

Thank you!
history.subject: Physics lower divs for technical electives?

history.content:
The updated list of approved technical electives (http://guide.berkeley.edu/undergraduate/degree-programs/computer-science/#majorrequirementstext) includes "All technical undergraduate and graduate courses in PHYSICS."

I think the old list said that only upper division and grad level courses were approved, so I would like to make sure that this has in fact been changed, and Physics (H)7A/B/C are now approved.

Thank you!
history.subject: Physics lower divs approved for technical electives?
